title: gendrya headcanon/theory
body: Arya now likes it when Gendry calls her ‘milady’. he’s the only one allowed to call her that and only right before or during sex

blog.name: thekingoforzammar
blog.title: Haven From Calamity
blog.description:
https://www.patreon.com/OnGloriousWings

“By ourselves we’re no one. It’s when other people look at us and see someone… that’s the moment we each start to exist.” -- Joshua (TWEWY) in KH3D.

"If you dwell in the dust, then wake up and sing" -- The Bravery, Song for Jacob

"As long as I live and there's blood in my arms, this is a day that is brighter then bombs." -- The Bravery, Song for Jacob

Pretty much the entirety of the song The Spectator.

"I'm not who I seem, who you thought I could be, the support you can lean up against when you need. I'm the dark when you want the lights out, at all costs. This is mine, that is yours, I'm the bricks in your wall." -- Coheed and Cambria, Evagria the Faithful

I'm an avid gamer, a lover of history, a lover of ancient politics (hate modern politics, because everyon'es pretty much an idiot in the political arena). Feel free to ask me whatever's on your mind.

Proud Child of the Fence and feminist-in-training. Possibly doing badly on that last part, but I always welcome discussion and education.

summary: You know what I wish we saw in the Battle of Winterfell? Or in the episode prior? NYMERIA AND HER WOLF PACK. I remember Arya...
body:
You know what I wish we saw in the Battle of Winterfell? Or in the episode prior?

NYMERIA AND HER WOLF PACK.

I remember Arya came across her once and there was a lot of tension because they didn’t quite have the tight bond as they used to but I just would have been so happy if we saw Nymeria come back and we had a legion of good boys and girls to attack the dead army and Nymeria/Arya become close again.

blog.name: okumurayui
blog.title: Teenege Queen
blog.description: My favorite photos, movies and series, animes with awesome quotes!

body:
GoT in 8x03 (Ladies mostly)

SPOILER ALERT.🚨🚨🚨

Okay. Let’s make some things clear. I heard a lot of people saying that Dany and Jon were useless in this battle. This is wrong. Like BULLSHIT. The dragons’ve done a lot. Burrying the White Walkers, for an example? The Night King appeared with Viseryon and made a winter storm or foggy (is this correct?) They could’t see nothing!!!

I give you, the battle scene “Dragons vs Dragon” was amazing and realistic.

Of course that was cool to see Jon riding a dragon, but he almost fell like, a thousand times. I think it would be more interesting see him fighting with Ghost side by side. He is much more a Stark than a Targaryen after all. But I have to adimit, it was an amazing scene.

Jon could have done more, I agree. But this is what I like in GoT. They are humans and show their failures is something I like to watch. Shows that even a hero is not invencible. Put yourself in Jon’s place. He was surrounded by an army it seemed to never be defeated. Winterfell, his home, was falling down. His friends dying one by one. Viseryon destroying the city. Not knowing if the rest of his family is ok. Think racionally in this situation is almost impossible.

Dany is strong. Not phisically, but mentally. She is a valient queen. Her dothoraki and army were devastaed in that fight. She lost Viseryon and Jorah. When she fell from Drogon, I totally tought she would die, then her loyalest knight came to save her, and instead of hide beside him, he took a damm sword and fought along side Sor Jorah. I do like Daenarys, she is not my fav one, but I like her. More than ever.

Take a sword and fight is not easy. It’s terrifying. You need be brave to do it. Dany never fought with a weapon. She only fought with her dragons and with words, because she is a politician. A conqueror, but not a soldier. See her taking a damm sword and kill white walkers is one of my top 5 moments of the episode.

Jaime and Brienne have done what we knew they would. Saving each other’s life was beautiful. My hearts can’t have enough of this ship.

Melissandre showing up was misteryous. Because of her, Winterfell and its people is safe. The fire was a great job, but her death made me with more questions than answers.

Brown eyes

Green eyes

Blue eyes

This was fucking awesome, though. She always knew Arya was the only one to kill the Night King. Since the second season.

Sansa and Tyrion. First of all. I do ship them. I was glowing when Tyrion said they shoud have stayed married. *Waves of feeling*. BUUUT, this is not the bloody point. Sansa is not a warrior, a fighter, much less a soldier. She is a lady. A political woman since when she saw that the world is not a fairy tail, and life is not pretty dresses. Expect her to fight using the dagger - Oh, that scene with Arya gave me feelings (Stick them with the pointy end) - or a sword, or any weapon is… Well, I don’t know the name in english for this.

Tyrion, otherwise, is not a soldier, though he knows how to handle a sword, but his valour as the Queen’s Hand is much more precious and important. Tyrion’s weapons are not steel. His truly and lethal weapon’re his intelligence. His knowledge. Their reaction to the battle in the crypts is all the way right with the characters personality and development.

Lyanna was a badass! Totally a badass! When the giant fell, and I saw her dead, it was like. *Tears and smiling.*

“My heroine, why you had to leave?! I’m so pround of you, my queen!!!!”

Let’s jump the protective dad Sandor (I’ll write about it later), and go for the one. Better, the “No One”. Arya Stark of Winterfell. I just loved her since the beginning of the books and the TV show, and pherhaps my opinion is a little bit blind. I also expected Jon to kill the Night King, but I loved it was her. Plot Twist, baby. I saw some people that was not her character alike. That she is cold and emotionless. That’s not truth. She is cold, yes, and cruel all the way. But everything she has ever done was because of her family. To avenge them. She is not emotionless. She has a lot of amotions under the mask of a cold assassin little girl (now a young woman). The thing is: she does not like to show any emotions anymore. For her is weakness. And weakness get you killed. She uses a mask of steel. She needs to look strong. In the books she addimited it to herself. The battle of winterfell was this mask being broken and I loved it.

But okay, that’s my opinion. She killing the NK was a good idea. It was unexpected, and makes some kind of sense.

“How did she fly behind him?” “How could none of them see her?” “How did she get there anyway?”

Well, I would say to you to rewatch the show. She was trained as a Faceless Man. The most talentous assassins in GoT universe. Includding in the books. She has the skills to do such a thing. Be furtive.

All the others were trained as knights, not killers.

Arya is not a Mary Sue, dammit.

Why do you even think the royalty send assassins when they have good knights? A knight can do the work, obviously, but would be catch easily what can start a war deppending of the situation.

The mistakes of the battle? Well, it was too short, even knowing that the TV Show, different from the books, is much more about who sits on the Iron Throne than the Night King itself, I guess it should have be a longer battle. With days of fighting. More despair. More loses. Not just one night. But okay, I hope that in the books the writer will work better on that.

But, I want to remember. It’s a war. Everyone fighting is a hero. Every single one of them all. Stop saying one character is more important than another, ’cause they are not. If battles could be won with just one person, we wold not have soldiers. We remember the leaders and the ones who ended the war, but we forget that without the warriors, a leader would do nothing, and “The Hero” would never exist.

This is all. I wish I could write more, but is too long the way that it is. Good night, people.

Brown eyes

Green eyes

Blue eyes

This was fucking awesome, though. She always knew Arya was the only one to kill the Night King. Since the second season.

Sansa and Tyrion. First of all. I do ship them. I was glowing when Tyrion said they shoud have stayed married. *Waves of feeling*. BUUUT, this is not the bloody point. Sansa is not a warrior, a fighter, much less a soldier. She is a lady. A political woman since when she saw that the world is not a fairy tail, and life is not pretty dresses. Expect her to fight using the dagger - Oh, that scene with Arya gave me feelings (Stick them with the pointy end) - or a sword, or any weapon is… Well, I don’t know the name in english for this.

Tyrion, otherwise, is not a soldier, though he knows how to handle a sword, but his valour as the Queen’s Hand is much more precious and important. Tyrion’s weapons are not steel. His truly and lethal weapon’re his intelligence. His knowledge. Their reaction to the battle in the crypts is all the way right with the characters personality and development.

Lyanna was a badass! Totally a badass! When the giant fell, and I saw her dead, it was like. *Tears and smiling.*

“My heroine, why you had to leave?! I’m so pround of you, my queen!!!!”

Let’s jump the protective dad Sandor (I’ll write about it later), and go for the one. Better, the “No One”. Arya Stark of Winterfell. I just loved her since the beginning of the books and the TV show, and pherhaps my opinion is a little bit blind. I also expected Jon to kill the Night King, but I loved it was her. Plot Twist, baby. I saw some people that was not her character alike. That she is cold and emotionless. That’s not truth. She is cold, yes, and cruel all the way. But everything she has ever done was because of her family. To avenge them. She is not emotionless. She has a lot of amotions under the mask of a cold assassin little girl (now a young woman). The thing is: she does not like to show any emotions anymore. For her is weakness. And weakness get you killed. She uses a mask of steel. She needs to look strong. In the books she addimited it to herself. The battle of winterfell was this mask being broken and I loved it.

But okay, that’s my opinion. She killing the NK was a good idea. It was unexpected, and makes some kind of sense.

“How did she fly behind him?” “How could none of them see her?” “How did she get there anyway?”

Well, I would say to you to rewatch the show. She was trained as a Faceless Man. The most talentous assassins in GoT universe. Includding in the books. She has the skills to do such a thing. Be furtive.

All the others were trained as knights, not killers.

Arya is not a Mary Sue, dammit.

Why do you even think the royalty send assassins when they have good knights? A knight can do the work, obviously, but would be catch easily what can start a war deppending of the situation.

The mistakes of the battle? Well, it was too short, even knowing that the TV Show, different from the books, is much more about who sits on the Iron Throne than the Night King itself, I guess it should have be a longer battle. With days of fighting. More despair. More loses. Not just one night. But okay, I hope that in the books the writer will work better on that.

But, I want to remember. It’s a war. Everyone fighting is a hero. Every single one of them all. Stop saying one character is more important than another, ’cause they are not. If battles could be won with just one person, we wold not have soldiers. We remember the leaders and the ones who ended the war, but we forget that without the warriors, a leader would do nothing, and “The Hero” would never exist.

This is all. I wish I could write more, but is too long the way that it is. Good night, people.

blog.title: Ser Podrick Payne
blog.description: Maya ♎ | INFP-T | Hufflepuff | Polish | Pan she/her | mostly SPN, SW and GOT |

body:
I have an opinion

Spoiler alert for the 3rd episode

Ok so I don’t want to throw any shade and I don’t want to sound hateful because I am not but I do have very mixed feelings on the turn that game of thrones took after this episode.

First of all I’d like to say a word about the Night King and more importantly, his death.

In my opinion and I know I’m not the only one who thinks this way, the king’s death left me rather… Dissapointed. Of course it was a big shocking twist that it was Arya that killed him and not Jon or Daenerys (though I think it should’ve been Jon a bit more) but if you think about it, when it comes to the lore we were introduced to this past seven seasons it really doesn’t make much sense.

I think that if it was Jon or Daenerys not only would it be accurate to the lore (Azor Ahai or TPTWP being from Aerys and Rhaella’s line) but it would also create a lot of tension for the next episodes.

If Jon killed the NK maybe the Lannister army found out about it and realized “Well damn the king of the north just won a war with a seemingly unbeatable opponent? Maybe he should be king of Westeros not Cersei after all? I mean,, he went out there and won while our current queen stayed here and didn’t do shit.” It’d also restore the northerners trust in him and further the conflict between him and Dany. That would be a great moment to show where her true values lie- will she give the throne to Jon because he: 1. has the birthright to it and 2. because he just saved the world or will she try for it regardless.

If Daenerys killed the NK maybe the Lannister army found out about it and realized “Well damn the mother of dragons just won a war with a seemingly unbeatable opponent? Maybe she should be queen of Westeros not Cersei after all? I mean,, she went out there and won while our current queen stayed here and didn’t do shit”. The north would realize they should’ve trusted her more because she just saved them and they’d have a much better reason to march with her for the throne.

Arya, while she was a badass, didn’t have much to do with the walkers story wise. In my opinion a much more satisfying way to expand her character would be if she was the one to kill Cersei. After all she was one of the very few people still on Arya’s list which seemed to play a big part in her arc. She could’ve crossed another name from that list by killing off the mountain for example.

How? Maybe during the Cleganebowl Sandor was losing and Arya could’ve saved him like he saved her back in Winterfell. I feel like that could’ve been a very sweet moment between the two furthering their relationship and a way of making them even.

I don’t think that what Melisandre prophesized for Arya about the eyes was really foreshadowing to her killing the NK as much as it was just about the fact that Arya would go on and become one of the greatest assasins Westeros has ever seen.

Of course we don’t really know what the end would be but if it turned out Arya was the one to kill Cersei as well as the NK I feel like that would be too much for one character that wasn’t really foreshadowed to do this much in any prior seasons so if I had to choose a character to kill Cersei the way the story is progressing now I’d choose Jaime.

Maybe this turn of events wouldn’t be too exciting or it wouldn’t be much of a plot twist but it would provide a satisfying finale and it wouldn’t feel like they were disregarding the way the story played out as much. Sacrificing the lore for shock value will never work and is just bad storytelling so I think D&D really shot themselves in the knee on this one.

(Also if they wanted to go for shock value imo they just should’ve killed more characters like they already did all these seasons.)

Anyways that is just my opinion, thank you for taking the time to read it and you’re welcome to share your point of view. I’m definitely open to debate.

summary: What Exactly Is Wrong With a “Mary Sue” Character?
title: What Exactly Is Wrong With a “Mary Sue” Character?
excerpt: Since the term "Mary Sue" is trending again due to foolish backlash against Arya Stark, let's talk about self-inserts, "Mary Sues," and internalized sexism.

title: fic: “alive and whole”
body:
AO3 or FFN

~1k, Jon & Sansa & Arya & Bran, G-rating, Season 8

Summary: Arya tugs out the catspaw, its Valyrian steel glinting in the light. She holds it out to Jon, as if a knight would regally present out their sword for a king’s blessing. “Like you said… I stuck him with the pointy end,” Arya says, cocking an eyebrow.

title: plottwist
body:
Arya: *jumps out of nowhere, gets caught by the Night King*
Sandor: *smashes all the wights, white walkers and the Night King* 
Sandor: NO ONE HURTS MY DAUGTHER, DON'T TOUCH HER YOU CUNTS!!!!
